metadata.title: CVE-2021-1252 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in the Excel XLM macro parsing module in Clam AntiVirus(ClamAV) Software versions 0.103.0 and 0.103.1 could allow anunauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service condition onan affected device. The vulnerability is due to improper error handlingthat may result in an infinite loop. An attacker could exploit thisvulnerability by sending a crafted Excel file to an affected device. Anexploit could allow the attacker to cause the ClamAV scanning process hang,resulting in a denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-1252` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-base - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamdscan - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libclamav9 - 0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.103.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
